amendment.description: Amendments en bloc consist of the text of amendments numbered 12, 13, 30, 33, 34, 35, 43, 49, 59, 61, 63, 65, 66, 69, 71, 78, 80, 82, 83, 86, 87, 96, 98, and 99 printed on pages H5648-H5652 in the Congressional Record for June 7, 1995.
amendment.purpose: An amendment consisting the following amendments, offered en bloc and printed in the Congressional Record on May 22, 23, and 24 as amendment Nos. 12 (Lantos), 13 (Livingston, modified), 30 (Condit, modified), 33 (Gilman, modified), 34 (Gilman, modified), 35 (Gilman, modified), 43 (Hoke, modified), 49 (King, modified), 59 (Roemer, modified), 61 (Rohrabacher, modified), 63 (Roth), 65 (Sawyer), 66 (Sawyer), 69 (Smith NJ), 71 (Toricelli), 78 (Zimmer), 80 (Bilbray), 82 (Burton), 83 (Chabot), 86 (Gilman), 87 (Hamilton), 96 (Schroeder, modified), 98 (Traficant, modified), and 99 (Traficant).

action.text: Gilman amendment (A014) modified by unanimous consent.
On agreeing to the Gilman amendments (A014) as modified Agreed to by voice vote.
